page.title: 16The Snake Man of Wormley
page.content:
Mr Newton lives in a cottage by the River Lea. His job is looking after the weir by his house. Not only is he a lock-keeper but he also has a fine collection of snakes and other unusual pets, such as tarantulas, rats, a parrot and a lizard. All of the snakes are constrictors but the tarantulas are poisonous.
The longest smake that Mr Newton has at the moment is a python that weighs over 36 kilos, measures nearly 5 metres and is still growing! The snakes are fed on rats and rabbits but Mr Newton never feeds them on live animals.
Many of Mr Newton's unusual pets have been on the television. One of the snakes also took part in a film called "Greystoke - The Legend Of Tarzan".
